com.github.i49.hibiscus.validation

Class BasicJsonValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.i49.hibiscus.validation.BasicJsonValidator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JsonValidator

    public class BasicJsonValidator
extends Object
implements JsonValidator
    An implementation class of JsonValidator interface and the base class of all custom JSON validators. This class is intended to be extended by application developers to build their own validators which have application specific schema.

    The schema to be used to validate JSON documents should be assigned to the object of this class by passing it to the constructor. For more information about how to define schema, please see SchemaComponents class.

    The following sample code shows how to write your own JSON validator by extending this class.

    
 import com.github.i49.hibiscus.validation.BasicJsonValidator;
 import com.github.i49.hibiscus.schema.Schema;
 import static com.github.i49.hibiscus.schema.SchemaComponents.*;
 
 public class PersonValidator extends BasicJsonValidator {
   // Schema definition.
   private static final Schema schema = schema(
     object(
       required("firstName", string()),
       required("lastName", string()),
       optional("age", integer()),
       optional("hobbies", array(string()))
     )
   );  
 
   public PersonValidator() {
     super(schema)
   }
 }

    For details about how to validate JSON documents by using this class, please see JsonValidator interface.

    See Also:
    SchemaComponents, JsonValidator

      • validate

        public ValidationResult validate(InputStream stream)
        Description copied from interface: JsonValidator
        Validates a JSON document which is to be read from InputStream. The character encoding of the stream is determined as specified in RFC 4627.
        Specified by:
        validate in interface JsonValidator
        Parameters:
        stream - the byte stream from which the JSON document is to be read.
        Returns:
        the validation result containing the JSON values and the problems detected in the process of the validation.
        See Also:
        RFC 4627: The application/json Media Type for JavaScript Object Notation (JSON)
